title: CANCELED | Sketch Class: One Work, Six Ways
title_display: CANCELED | Sketch Class: One Work, Six Ways
short_description:
Six Saturdays
March 14–April 25 (no class April 11)
10:45–12:45 

Artists often work in series, revisiting a theme or subject they want to explore deeply multiple times. In this six-week class, focus deeply on one artwork and approach it in a myriad of ways using an expanded range of materials. Fully engage your vision and imagination as well as your drawing skills in this iterative process. 

Please note that this class focuses on creative exploration, with less emphasis on providing drawing instruction. We recommend that participants have some prior experience with drawing and/or feel comfortable with diving into a creative drawing project.

This class is for people ages 16 and up. All materials will be provided.
description:
In the interest of the health and safety of our visitors, guest speakers, performers, and staff, we are canceling all events through April 10. We hope to reschedule this program and will let all current registrants know of the new date as soon as it’s set. 

Please review other precautionary measures the museum is taking due to COVID-19.

Six Saturdays
March 14–April 25 (no class April 11)
10:45–12:45 

Artists often work in series, revisiting a theme or subject they want to explore deeply multiple times. In this six-week class, focus deeply on one artwork and approach it in a myriad of ways using an expanded range of materials. Fully engage your vision and imagination as well as your drawing skills in this iterative process. 

Please note that this class focuses on creative exploration, with less emphasis on providing drawing instruction. We recommend that participants have some prior experience with drawing and/or feel comfortable with diving into a creative drawing project.

This class is for people ages 16 and up. All materials will be provided.

About the Instructor 
Mark Krisco is an art history lecturer and sketch instructor with over 25 years of experience at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago. In addition to lecturing at SAIC and the Oxford Round Table, he has served a curator for the Dr. Martin and Francey Gecht Collection, the Marshall Field’s Archives, and the Pope John Paul II Newman Center in Washington, DC.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
